contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title prefixed|3}} '''USS ''Roanoke''''' may refer to: * A 7-gun schooner named ''Roanoke'' was transferred from the State Department to the Navy in 1814, and sold in 1816, but there is no known records of her operations. *{{USS|Roanoke|1855}} was a [[screw frigate]] commissioned in 1857, converted to carry three revolving turrets in 1863, and in periodic use until 1882 *{{USS|Roanoke|ID-1695}} was the civilian vessel ''El Dia'' converted to a minelayer in 1917 and returned in 1919 *{{USS|Roanoke|PF-93}} was a {{sclass-|Tacoma|frigate|0}} patrol gunboat, reclassified as a patrol frigate, then renamed ''Lorain'' in 1944 while under construction * {{USS|Roanoke|CL-114}}, a {{sclass-|Fargo|cruiser|0}} light cruiser, was canceled on 5 October 1944, prior to the start of construction * {{USS|Roanoke|CL-145}} was a {{sclass-|Worcester|cruiser|0}} light cruiser in service from 1949 to 1958 * {{USNS|Roanoke|T-AOR-155}} was a fleet replenishment oiler from 1956 to 1957 * {{USS|Roanoke|AOR-7}} was a {{sclass-|Wichita|replenishment oiler|0}} replenishment oiler in service from 1976 to 1995 {{Shipindex}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Roanoke, USS}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]]
